thread.title: Shocking final image shows Kim Jong-nam slumped unconscious in airport after being poisoned 'by North Korean hit squad'
thread.title_full: Shocking final image shows Kim Jong-nam slumped unconscious in airport after being poisoned 'by North Korean hit squad' - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Shocking final image shows Kim Jong-nam slumped unconscious in airport after being poisoned 'by North Korean hit squad'

organizations.name: cancel play now watch next ukip

text:
Shocking final image shows Kim Jong-nam slumped unconscious in airport after being poisoned 'by North Korean hit squad' The picture has emerged as Malaysian police reportedly narrow in on four suspects who remain on the run Share Comments By Jeremy Armstrong Steve Robson 03:24, 18 FEB 2017 Updated 03:29, 18 FEB 2017 News Kim Jong-nam unconscious on the front page of newspaper the New Straits Times (Photo: Twitter/NST_Online) Share Comments Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email Unconscious and slumped in an airport chair, this shocking image shows the final moments of Kim Jong-nam.
The half-brother of Kim Jong-un is believed to have been poisoned by a hit squad sent by the North Korean despot on Monday.
Jong-nam, 46, had been critical of the Jong-un regime and it is believed his unstable younger sibling may have feared he may one day return to take power.
The audacious killing was carried out as Jong-nam waited to use a check-in kiosk at Malaysia's Kuala Lumpur airport.
Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Kim Jong-nam was poisoned as he waited for a flight in Kuala Lumpur airport (Photo: Reuters) Suspected assassin wearing LOL sweatshirt Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch Next Ukip leader Paul Nuttall gets a standing ovation Watch this video again Watch Next Watch Tony Blair's dramatic Labour and Brexit-ske 27:42 Disgusted mum-of-two's horror at biting into KFC 0:48 Steve Irwin's son is following in his father's fo 0:35 Ricky Martin explains how he met his husband on I 0:29 Katie Price claims Happy Xmas sign is up because 0:27 David Brent's iconic dance 0:26 Two Kentucky sheriff's fight in front of prisoners 1:52 Emmerdale tease fans about Robert and Aaron's wed 0:57 Video will play in Is this the Assassin on the day of the murder? Share this video Watch Next It is believed he was held in a choke hold from behind as a fast-acting poison was administered either via a cloth, needle or spray.
Jong-un staggered to the toilets and then alerted staff that he was unwell.
The New Straits Times showed the final picture of Jong-un on Saturday's front page along with CCTV images of the four remaining suspects.
Malaysian police are said to be closing in on them after making a fourth arrest last night.
The masterminds of the killing were said have been watching on from a restaurant just 50m away.
Two women and a man are already being held.
One of the women involved in the murder was allegedly paid just £80 - but thought it was a video ‘prank’.
Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch Next Winning lottery number for Friday February 21 Watch this video again Watch Next Incident caught on camera 1:24 Big Benefits Handout family disgusted after NHS s 1:21 Rhian Sugden gives cheeky smile as she gets Brazi 0:32 Emotional Paul Nuttall talks about Hillsbrough 0:45 Daphney Sanasie on First Dates 0:34 Scantily clad campaigners stage revealing protest 0:46 A year's FREE council tax if you shop an irrespon 1:08 Crime scenes closed off and police patrol where 2 0:29 Video will play in Kim Jong-un's half brother 'assassinated' at Malaysia airport Share this video Watch Next Passport photo of Siti Aisyah Suspect Siti Aishah was approached in a nightclub by a ‘mysterious stranger’ prior to the assassination of Kim Jong-nam , it has been claimed.
The man purportedly offered her 100 US Dollars, the equivalent of around £80, to carry out what she thought was a ‘prank’.
She did not know her four male accomplices - and had never heard of Jong-nam.
Siti, 25, and Doan Thi Huong, 29 - the woman seen in the ‘LOL’ T-shirt on CCTV - were reportedly ‘duped’ into carrying out the assassination by North Korean agents.
The two women were said to have stayed in China for up to three months where they worked as female escorts.
Kim Jong-Nam (Photo: AFP) Kim Jong-Nam (Photo: AFP) It is claimed they were both approached by a man who introduced Doan to the four male accomplices who are still on the run.
Siti only got involved when Doan was asked by the man to find a partner to shoot the ‘prank video’.
The duo agreed and rehearsed the “spoof” so they could do it in a matter of seconds.
Aishah was asked to use a handkerchief to cover Jong-nam’s face while Doan practised administering an injection, according to local media.
Both women claimed that they had no idea what was really happening. Jong nam’s last words before he died - uttered in English to airport staff - were ‘very painful, very painful, I was sprayed liquid’.
North Korean leader Kim Jong-Il (sitting-L) with his son, Kim Jong-Nam (Photo: AFP) Intelligence agencies in South Korea and the US insist it was a ‘hit’ carried out by North Korean tyrant Kim to protect his hold on power in the secretive communist state.
According to China Press, his estranged half brother staggered 15m to a service counter after Monday’s attack at Kuala Lumpur airport in Malaysia.
After that, he could only ‘grimace’ and ‘groan’. Staff on the fourth floor of the budget airline terminal then stopped policemen for help to take him to the airport clinic.
He lost consciousness and was immediately transferred to nearby Putrajaya Hospital.
A North Korea official leaves the morgue at Kuala Lumpur General Hospital (Photo: REUTERS) But he died on the way, prompting speculation a deadly toxin such as ricin was used to poison him. No ‘puncture’ wounds were found on his body.
Jong-nam, the illegitimate playboy son of former North Korean leader Kim Jong-ill, received threats after he criticised the country’s regime in 2012, according to Japanese journalist Yoji Gomi.
He had been warned directly from North Korea to ‘refrain from talking politics.’ Jong-nam had also told him Kim Jong-un would not last as a leader and hereditary succession was a ‘joke’ to the outside world.
Kim Jong-un (Photo: Reuters) Malaysia police Special Branch director Datuk Seri Mohamad Fuzi Harun said they had ‘no reason’ to believe the murder was the work of foreign agents at this stage.
But he added: “There are definitely other individuals involved, apart from the two assailants.”
Aishah, from Indonesia, was said to be working in a Kuala Lumpur nightclub when she was approached by the mystery stranger.
Her Malaysian boyfriend Muhammad Farid Bin Jalaluddin, 26, was also arrested over the death. The attack took just five seconds to carry out.
 Comments Show more comments More On Kim Jong-nam Kim Jong-un North Korea Murder
